author: juststaking
title: Grow India, Grow Cardano
description: Como podemos fazer crescer o desenvolvimento e a adoção de Cardano na Índia?

f6_assessments.q0: Dentro do mesmo estado de espírito que fez da África o principal alvo geográfico da adoção de Cardano, todos os desafios geográficos dentro das áreas da maioria dos países em desenvolvimento do mundo são da maior importância para a adoção e difusão em massa de Cardano. Eles são os que geram os projetos mais visíveis para os novos membros, que geram a primeira abordagem e a forma mais palpável de integração para os novos membros da economia emergente. Dito isto, a Índia tem as características de uma região de alta desigualdade, com uma população muito grande, alta porcentagem de pessoas sem banco e alto envolvimento com novas tecnologias. Esta é uma região propícia para a ruptura através da criptoeconomia, e o uso de projetos liderados por Cardano garantirá uma posição predominante no mercado para Cardano desde um estágio inicial, a disseminação de SPOs, a maximização do volume de transações e o onboarding de novos membros.
f6_assessments.q1: O proponente tem um histórico de envolvimento com a Comunidade e múltiplas propostas já apresentadas, sempre centradas na Índia como uma área geográfica madura para o desenvolvimento de Cardano. A presença da EMURGO Índia também poderia proporcionar a oportunidade para algumas sinergias a serem desenvolvidas com propostas financiadas e organizações/DAOs/Dapps subseqüentes. Seria interessante saber, para uma futura iteração, se existem outros membros da equipe que poderiam compor a equipe do Desafio para este desafio proposto, talvez com membros da Comunidade de outras regiões da Índia, de modo a dar uma conformação mais diversificada do painel à equipe do Desafio e permitir encontros físicos e o desenvolvimento da Comunidade em diferentes pólos dentro do país.
f6_assessments.q2: Como em outros desafios geográficos, as propostas centralizam as principais métricas em torno de quantas propostas são apresentadas e quantos Dapps/DAOs/serviços centrados na Índia são trazidos à tona e potencialmente financiados por este mecanismo. Nas diferentes iterações do Fundo, os desafios geográficos geralmente têm atraído muita atenção e um grande número de propostas, especialmente em sua primeira iteração; portanto, seria seguro assumir que um desafio Grow India, Grow Cardano em sua primeira iteração atrairia muitas propostas novas, alguns exemplos das quais são mencionados pelo proponente dentro da descrição. Entretanto, seria interessante incluir também como KPIs do sucesso do desafio o aumento do volume de transações de Cardano no subcontinente indiano, o aumento das SPOs baseadas na Índia, entre outros.

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

India is big target market with a population of 1.4 billion people, so growing the adoption of Cardano and participation in its ecosystem supports the Fund 8 strategic goals of growing the number of contributors and growing the dev and app ecosystem.

At the same time, the proposal defines the objectives as "Indian focused" projects, which could limit the potential global impact of developed solutions.

I believe that considering the following points could make the proposal stronger:
1) reformulate the proposal from requesting Indian-focused projects to projects that target use cases needed in India but potentially helping other regions too!
2) Provide an analysis of use cases that could be a great growth points in India based on technological readiness, regulatory readiness, and the local demand.
3) Provide several examples of a successful adoption of blockchain in India to provide insights into potential impact and the complexity of projects.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of a discusion about the ability to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 4.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the broad skillsets of the Cardano community and experiences with growth-focused projects targeting other regions, the community is well positioned to address the challenge.

The proposal would be stronger if the challenge team included members that new the region well and could provide experience-based insights and feedback to the participants.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of a challenge team experienced with the region, reducing the ability to provide advice and experience-based insights to participants.
My rating is 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal sets metrics (the number of projects, the number of apps) that can track the initiative-related activity.

However, those metrics are not sufficient to track the progress towards the underlying objective (broader adoption of Cardano in India, more contributors to Caradano ecosystem coming from India) and supporting the strategic goals of Fund8. To make the proposal stronger, I'd suggest to consider some of the following metrics:
1) the % of walltes created from India.
2) the % of voters from India.
3) the % of proposers from India.
4) the % of apps built by developers from India.
5) the % of cardano users using apps built by developers from India.
6) the satisfaction of users of apps built within the initiative vs that of competirors.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: It is common knowledge India has an immense pool of English speaking human resources with very low entry barriers in the IT world. It is the second populous country in the planet. To open an Indian themed Catalyst Challenge can indeed become quite fruitful. Opening  doors to expand Cardano community in  India, can form over time another branch of developers and incentivize a significant app ecosystem intrinsically rooted in India use cases. We should keep in mind large chunks of India population suffers from the same problems Cardano seeks to address throughout Africa and Latin America, such as economic development, financial and social inclusion.
f6_assessments.q1:
As far as we know Emurgo - one of the Cardano founding entities - has boots on the ground  in India for some time. Perhaps there could be room for collaboration on  community initiatives arising from this Challenge. The bottom line is Cardano community has capacity to address this challenge. We have living examples on the ongoing Africa and Latin American themed challenges. India has a  larger pool of resources with lower entry barriers. The Challenge relative small budget of 150K seems prudent looking for first engagement.
In a final note  being a complete new challenge proposal on Catalyst, would be more beneficial if the proposer have introduced a Challenge team. There is still a chance to do so once Challenge proposal receives voters approval.
f6_assessments.q2: Key metrics could have been more expanded to measure success and progress, however being a first time challenge proposal I sense caution by the author. Challenge brief lists future project  examples based on education, marketing among other community events introducing Cardano. It is great  inspiration for future proposers!

f6_assessments.q0: Along with Africa and Latin America, India represents another area with potential that has not yet been addressed by Project Catalyst. It is known that India places a high emphasis on science and technology, recognizing its importance for economic growth. In terms of scientific research, India is one top nations around the world, and it is also among the top nations in terms of space exploration. I agree that this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1: It has shown that this type of challenge pays off very well, so I believe it will be able to tackle it successfully. A budget of $150000 appears reasonable to me. Depending on how the community responds, we may increase funding in the future.
f6_assessments.q2: Both the proposed definition of success as well as the metrics proposed make sense to me because both will allow the community to be updated on the status of the proposals as they are implemented. I believe the success criteria and suggested metrics are appropriate for tracking progress towards meeting the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: Targeting a specific region for Cardano growth is a common method for aligning with Cardano's mission. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: This challenge overlaps with many others seeking to grow specific regions. The budget is typical for this type of challenge. The community has the capacity to address this challenge individually however collectively these region specific challenges will need to be prioritized as it is unlikely there is the capacity for all of them. There are some concerns about the India regulatory environment which has recently announced potential laws against cryptocurrencies. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate the demonstrated demand for the proposed budget (most easily done based upon excess total proposal budgets in previous funding rounds).
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and suggested metrics are adequate. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0:
India is known for its dynamism, innovation-ready qualities in Asia right now [similar to the qualities Cardano looks for in Africa]. This proposal's argument convinces me much that India should be focused on.
I agree with this proposal's alignment, I can rate the alignment of this proposal only with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: Community members who come from Asia, as a whole, (and Southeast Asia in particular) are increasing through time. However, I did not see this readiness in India. This proposal should explain this more in detail for clarifying if the Catalyst community has the capacity to address this challenge. Based on the given information, I am still neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate the feasibility of this proposal only with a score of 3.
f6_assessments.q2: Suggested directions and metrics are logical to measure progress in addressing this challenge, except the metric of "Increased interaction between Catalyst and Indian focused projects", since "interaction" is still unclear of how to measure this. After all, based on the given information, I still agree with this proposal's verifiability, I can rate the verifiability of this proposal only with a score of 4

importance:
1.4B pessoas. 55% menores de 30 anos (2016 est)
Desenvolvedores/empresas locais de Cardano necessários para resolver problemas locais.  
Pobreza significativa/desbanqueada
success: O sucesso é ter múltiplas submissões para o Catalyst Fund8 para projetos voltados para a Índia, com projetos do mundo real sendo financiados e construídos.
